; Sun, 19 Nov 2023 10:25:04 +0800 冒充专家行医十年，靠秘方自制抗癌药：无证“神医”的罪与罚http://www.infzm.com/contents/260877
;;2023-11-19 08:59:00;
;

;;

;

;"Miracle doctors" sell a bunch of titles to their patients. Nongjian Illustration

;

;Qingdao’s “old Chinese medicine doctor” Hou Yuanxiang, who pretended to be an expert and professor and practiced medicine illegally for more than ten years, fell for his homemade “anti-cancer drug” - in February 2023, Hou Yuanxiang was arrested by Qingdao at first instance The Huangdao District People's Court of the city sentenced him to 12 years in prison and fined him 12 million yuan for "producing and selling counterfeit drugs."

;

;Like Hou Yuanxiang, his daughter, son, wife and former son-in-law were also sentenced for "producing and selling counterfeit drugs" and were sentenced to prison terms ranging from 11 to 3 years respectively. In addition, the son of Hou Yuanxiang's third sister was also involved in the case. He was sentenced to 11 years in prison for "fraud" and "harboring" in the first instance.

;

;The total prison term for the above six people is 50 years, and the total fine is 29.8 million yuan. Southern Weekend reporters searched online for judgment documents and found that among counterfeit drug cases in recent years, the first-instance verdict in Hou Yuanxiang's case was extremely rare in terms of heavy sentencing and high fines.

;

;However, the case has not yet been settled. After the first-instance verdict, as Hou Yuanxiang and others filed an appeal, many self-media appeared on the Internet to "cry out injustice" for them. Some associated the case with the "folk traditional Chinese medicine" group, believing that "if this lawsuit is lost, almost all folk Chinese medicine practitioners must close their doors." (For details, please see the report ;"The Online Public Opinion War on the "Miracle Cancer Doctor";)

;

;Hou Yuanxiang's agent The lawyer questioned the characterization of the drugs involved in the case, arguing that after the revision of the Drug Administration Law in 2019, the threshold for identification of counterfeit drugs has been raised. Hou Yuanxiang’s self-made medicine is made of traditional Chinese medicinal materials and should not be identified as counterfeit drugs. Hou Yuanxiang does not constitute “production.” , the crime of selling counterfeit medicines."

;

;On August 30, 2023, the Qingdao Intermediate People’s Court ruled to revoke the original judgment and remand the case for retrial on the grounds that the first-instance judgment “had unclear facts and insufficient evidence.”

;

;The "old Chinese doctor" who can't take the pulse

;

;After being criminally detained on February 17, 2022, Hou Yuanxiang only stayed in the detention center for more than 20 days. After that, the police changed the enforcement measures to "residential surveillance" because of his illness.

;

;Li Gang, the second-instance attorney, met Hou Yuanxiang after the National Day in 2023. According to him, two policemen worked in three shifts, watching him 24 hours a day, "maybe because there are more patients coming to him."

;

;According to the first-instance verdict, 66-year-old Hou Yuanxiang is from Shandong A native of Yishui County, Linyi City, the province, he once worked as a teacher in the county, but later took a leave of absence without pay and became a doctor. After that, he moved his family to Weifang and settled down. Around 2019, after purchasing real estate in Qingdao, Hou Yuanxiang and his wife and their daughter Hou Jing and his wife both moved their household registrations to Qingdao.

;

;Hou Yuanxiang’s confession cited in the first-instance verdict did not explain his medical experience. Some self-media said that Hou Yuanxiang studied under two "famous Chinese medicine doctors" Zhang Moumou and Lou Moumou, but Southern Weekend reporters did not find any information about the latter two as "famous Chinese medicine doctors".

;

;However, it is certain that Hou Yuanxiang is not from a "family of traditional Chinese medicine" or "six generations practicing medicine" as some self-media said.

;

;According to what Hou Yuanxiang’s wife and sister told China News Weekly, Hou Yuanxiang was originally a primary school teacher and started studying medicine when he was about 40 years old. He had “several teachers” but “all of them are gone.” This relative emphasized that Hou Yuanxiang was "excellent" in taking his pulse - he could tell whether it was cancer or what kind of cancer it was by just touching it.

;

;As a daughter-in-law, Li Jianying told Southern Weekend reporters that she did not know how Hou Yuanxiang learned Chinese medicine.

;

;Most patients call Hou Yuanxiang "Professor Hou", and Hou Yuanxiang's WeChat signature is also "Professor Hou". The "Central Health" website, which claims to provide communication, display, and promotion services for "folk doctors," still has Hou Yuanxiang's personal introduction, calling him an "international doctor of medicine" and "an authoritative international cancer expert."

;

;However, according to Hou Yuanxiang’s confession, his online profiles, including “Professor of Chinese Medical College” and “Doctor of International Medicine”, “are all false” and “are intended to expand influence and make patients believe I".

;

;In fact, Hou Yuanxiang did not even obtain a medical practicing certificate. Since the implementation of the Practicing Physician Law in 1999, regardless of whether it is traditional Chinese medicine or Western medicine, all practitioners must have a physician's practice certificate. Otherwise, it will be regarded as "illegal practice of medicine", and they will be subject to administrative penalties in the lightest case and criminal liability in the worst case.

;

;A patient surnamed Xu testified that she began to seek medical treatment from Hou Yuanxiang in 2014. Since then, she has introduced many patients to Hou, and also asked Hou to attend a consultation at his winery. In 2019, she and Hou Yuanxiang co-organized When he went to the hospital, he found that Hou could not produce his medical license, so he doubted his identity.

;

;Not only patients, but also some senior medical professionals had no doubts about Hou Yuanxiang's identity and ability. According to the first-instance verdict, Hou Yuanxiang had been a doctor at Deyi Hall, a private traditional Chinese medicine hospital in Qingdao for a long time. Later, the person in charge of Deyi Hall asked Hou Yuanxiang to attach his medical qualification to the hospital. However, Hou Yuanxiang refused, and the two parties terminated the cooperation.

;

;According to the testimony of Shen Yufa, director of Zibo Yiyuan Ruikang Hospital, around 2010, he met Hou Yuanxiang at a medical academic conference in Beijing. “Many people attending the conference at that time said that Professor Hou was a doctor of traditional Chinese medicine. He is famous for tumors, cancer, and cardiovascular and cerebrovascular diseases."

;

;Later, Shen Yufa’s wife got cancer and took Hou Yuanxiang’s homemade medicine. Shen Yufa also hired Hou as a "part-time professor" at Ruikang Hospital and sold Hou's medicine at the hospital.

;

;According to Hou Yuanxiang’s confession, Shen Yufa once invited him to sit in Ruikang Hospital, but he refused because he did not have a medical license. The two parties only cooperated on selling medicines. However, Shen Yufa's son and another employee of the hospital confirmed that Hou Yuanxiang did not attend the hospital regularly.

;

;In addition to private hospitals, Hou Yuanxiang has also worked with public hospitals. In 2016, Weifang Municipal Government Hospital, a public hospital, posted on its WeChat official account that Hou Yuanxiang was an "authoritative expert in international cancer research" and would conduct monthly consultations at the branch of traditional Chinese medicine. This article disappeared only recently.

;

;Patients trust Hou Yuanxiang not only because of his impressive online resume, but also because of his “accurate” pulse numbering.

;

;Dong Shijie is a relative of Hou Yuanxiang, a Jilin patient. According to him, Hou Yuanxiang once traveled to Changbai Mountain and hosted meals by himself. Hou Yuanxiang took his pulse on the spot. "I have a friend who has high blood lipids and high blood pressure, and he can detect it," Dong Shijie told a reporter from Southern Weekend.

;

;However, according to the first-instance verdict, Hou Yuanxiang admitted to the investigators that he actually could not take a pulse. The reason for pretending to know the pulse is "to put it bluntly, it is to let the patient buy medicine."

;

;When he learned that Hou Yuanxiang could not check the pulse, Dong Shijie was shocked: "He is a traditional Chinese medicine doctor. What kind of disease would he treat if he could not check the pulse?"

;

;"The whole family went into hiding" after the incident

;

;According to the first-instance judgment, since 2011, Hou Yuanxiang, Hou Jing and others, without obtaining a drug production license, a drug business license, etc., posted Hou Yuanxiang’s false personal profile on the Internet to spread information in many places in Shandong Consulting and selling drugs claiming to be anti-cancer.

;

;In Hou Yuanxiang’s counterfeit drug case, the first person to be involved was his daughter Hou Jing—like her father, she did not have a medical certificate. On January 16, 2022, after receiving complaints and reports, multiple departments in Huangdao District, Qingdao City jointly conducted law enforcement and captured Hou Jing on the spot. Later, Hou Jing confessed to Hou Yuanxiang, his brother Hou Lei and others.

;

;According to the first-instance verdict, Hou Yuanxiang was at his home in Weifang at the time. He didn’t seem to care at first. It wasn’t until Hou Jing was detained and he was interrogated by the police that he realized the seriousness of the situation and transferred the self-made medicine to Qingdao Clinic overnight. and production tools, but it was too late.

;

;The court of first instance found that after Hou Jing was detained, Hou Yuanxiang's wife went to the police station handling the case to inquire about information, and "hidden the whole family" after returning home for an excuse. The police then pursued the Hou family online.

;

;According to Hou Lei’s confession, Hou Yuanxiang called him the day after Hou Jing was arrested. "Two or three days later, my father said that this was a serious matter and asked me not to use my current mobile phone and to go out and hide. After hanging up the phone, I took out the phone card and threw it in the trash."

;

;As for how Hou Lei participated in these businesses, Hou Lei said that in the winter of 2019, Hou Yuanxiang "asked me to apply for a bank card in the name of my wife Li Jianying... and asked me to pretend Director Li of the hospital, if a patient wants to buy medicine, call me and ask me to give the patient a bank card so that the patient can transfer money."

;

;According to Hou Yuanxiang’s confession, Hou Jing and Hou Lei had a bad relationship. After Hou Lei knew that Hou Jing was making money, he also wanted to sell medicine with his father. He asked him for the formula many times, but Hou Yuanxiang did not give it. He just asked Hou Lei to follow him and pay him a salary.

;

;Li Jianying told Southern Weekend reporters that Hou Lei helped Hou Yuanxiang deliver goods in Weifang, "equivalent to a courier." In the first-instance verdict, Hou Lei was sentenced to "producing and selling counterfeit drugs" according to law, and was sentenced to 8 years in prison and fined 5 million yuan.

;

;According to Hou Lei's confession, after hiding for a few days, he received a call from Hou Yuanxiang from an unknown number, suggesting that he go to the third aunt's house in Qingdao to celebrate the New Year, and then the whole family went to the third aunt's house. According to Hou Lei's confession, because he felt that "the matter was quite serious", he once suggested that his father surrender. "My father was very angry and said that I was not his biological child."

;

;Li Shuai, the son of Hou Lei’s third aunt, told Hou Lei that he had the connections to settle the matter, but he would need 4 million yuan. After several communications, Hou Lei asked his ex-brother-in-law Fu Songjie to send 2 million yuan in cash to Li Shuai after he had already paid 500,000 yuan. Li Shuai confessed that when he saw Fu Songjie coming to the door with a sack of money, he was stunned: "This is the first time I have seen so much money."

;

;Fu Songjie was originally from a district in Weifang City In 2019, he resigned and went to Qingdao at the request of his ex-wife Hou Jing. Before resigning, Hou Yuanxiang approached him and asked him to serve as the legal representative of a private hospital in which Hou was a shareholder. After Fu Songjie arrived in Qingdao, he caught up with the epidemic and had no job, so he helped his father-in-law and his ex-wife, and ended up becoming an accomplice. Fu Songjie was sentenced to 3 years in prison and fined 500,000 yuan in the first instance. The sentence was the shortest among all those involved in the case, and Fu was the only one who did not appeal.

;

;After Hou Lei was arrested, he confessed Li Shuai. In the next three days, Li Shuai, Fu Songjie and Hou Yuanxiang were arrested one after another.

;

;According to Hou Yuanxiang, in addition to the above 2.5 million yuan, Li Shuai also defrauded him of more than 2 million yuan. The first-instance judgment confirmed the matter and stated that "it will be separately investigated and handled by the public security organs."

;

;In the Hou Yuanxiang counterfeit drug case, the police seized a total of 8 houses in the Hou family.

;

;In late February 2022, a week after Hou Yuanxiang was arrested, the Ministry of Public Security announced the first batch of eight major typical drug crime cases to be supervised, and Hou Yuanxiang’s fake drug case was among them.

;

;"Secret Recipes" of Unknown Origin

;

;In the Hou Yuanxiang case, the medicines that were classified as fake were four self-made medicines by Hou Yuanxiang and his daughter, two of which were named " Anti-Cancer No. 1” and “Anti-Cancer No. 2”. According to Hou Yuanxiang's confession, these two medicines were made according to a "secret recipe."

;

;However, Hou Yuanxiang has different opinions on the origin of this "secret recipe". During the investigation stage of the case, he said that the secret recipe came from one of his "second grandfathers." This recipe originally contained five kinds of medicine. On this basis, Hou Yuanxiang added shiitake mushrooms, ganoderma lucidum, and cordyceps. "Even if this recipe is my own creation, I I have always wanted to promote this prescription and sell the medicine to make money."

;

;However, during the trial stage of the case, Hou Yuanxiang’s statement about the “secret recipe” changed—he claimed that the recipe was given to him by his “teacher” at the end of 2019.

;

;Hou Yuanxiang’s different statements about the source of the secret recipe puzzled a second-instance attorney: “Perhaps only he himself knows the truth.”

;

;The first-instance judgment quoted an attorney of the Hou family According to the lawyer, Hou Yuanxiang's anti-cancer "secret recipe" contains many Chinese medicinal materials such as shiitake mushrooms, cordyceps, Ganoderma lucidum, Prunella vulgaris, black dates, kelp, burdock root, dandelion root, ginseng, astragalus, angelica and so on.

;

;A Chinese medicine practitioner who has been practicing for more than 40 years told Southern Weekend reporters that the Chinese medicinal materials in Hou Yuanxiang’s prescription include both “tonifying” and “attacking” ingredients, such as ginseng, Astragalus, when cancer patients reach the middle and late stages, most of them are relatively weak, so it is beneficial to use some tonics; "attack" medicines such as kelp, which has the effect of clearing away heat and dissipating stagnation, is only suitable for some early-stage cancer patients and is not suitable for late-stage cancer patients.

;

;Among Hou Yuanxiang’s patients, there are many terminal cancer patients, and some came to Hou Yuanxiang because they were “sentenced to death by the hospital.”

;

;Different from traditional Chinese medicine (TCM), which treats patients according to prescriptions, Hou Yuanxiang’s anti-cancer drugs are prepared in advance, bagged and then sold to patients. According to his confession, around November 2020, Hou Jing purchased a decoction-making machine online. Since then, the father and daughter have taken turns using this machine to make decoctions, "and can make about 80 bags a day."

;

;The price of "Anti-cancer No. 1" is 4,620 yuan per serving, and "Anti-cancer No. 2" is 1,920 yuan. One dose is taken for one course of treatment, and one course of treatment lasts for 12 days.

;

;As for Hou Yuanxiang’s homemade anti-cancer drugs, Zhao Yin, a lawyer who graduated from the University of Traditional Chinese Medicine and has worked in the clinical department of traditional Chinese medicine in the hospital for many years, believes that it is definitely illegal. According to her, Hou Yuanxiang's self-made medicines are similar to "medical institution (TCM) preparations" in hospitals, which refer to fixed prescription preparations prepared by medical institutions for their own use after approval based on the clinical needs of the unit. However, hospital preparations, like medicines, generally need to be approved by the drug regulatory department before they can be produced and sold. In principle, they can only be produced by the hospital for their own use and cannot be sold externally.

;

;Zhao Yin said that after the promulgation of the Traditional Chinese Medicine Law in 2017, the state has relaxed its management of traditional Chinese medicine preparations. Traditional Chinese medicine preparations that only use traditional techniques do not need to obtain a preparation approval number and only need to apply for a preparation approval number. It can be prepared after registration with the provincial drug regulatory department.

;

;However, Hou Yuanxiang’s self-made medicine has also not been registered.

;

;The Traditional Chinese Medicine Law stipulates that medical institutions that prepare traditional Chinese medicine preparations that should be registered but fail to do so will be punished as producing counterfeit drugs.

;

;Zhao Yin also doubted whether Hou Yuanxiang’s homemade anti-cancer medicine really contained a sufficient amount of Chinese medicinal materials such as cordyceps claimed in the “secret recipe” because the medicine was made by Hou Yuanxiang and his daughter themselves and there was no formula. The production process standards lack proper supervision and supervision. However, quantitative detection of Cordyceps sinensis is very difficult.

;

;According to Fu Songjie’s confession, Hou Jing would send Liuwei Dihuang Pills and other Chinese patent medicines to patients together with the boiled Chinese medicine liquid. In Zhao Yin's view, in this way, even if the patient feels effective after taking the medicine, it may be the effect of the proprietary Chinese medicine.

;

;In order to avoid the characterization of "fake medicine", Hou Yuanxiang once tried to defend himself by claiming that "medicine and food have the same origin", which means that what he sells is food. However, due to the labeling of drug names such as "Anti-cancer No. 1" and "Anti-cancer No. 2", his defense is difficult to establish.

;

;Zhao Yin believes that the drug names "Anti-cancer No. 1" and "Anti-cancer No. 2" are nondescript, because cancer is a concept of Western medicine, and traditional Chinese medicine generally does not have the term "cancer" or "tumor". Instead, it is called "accumulation of symptoms."

;

;As for Hou Yuanxiang’s practice of making homemade anti-cancer drugs, the above-mentioned traditional Chinese medicine doctors interviewed by Southern Weekend reporters called him “too courageous”. In his opinion, many Chinese medicine practitioners have secret recipes. In order not to reveal the secret recipes, they usually only sell the medicinal materials to patients. At most, they cook them for the patients. They certainly dare not make their own medicines and sell them to patients.

;

;Have any cancer patients been cured?

;

;However, supporters "voted injustice" against Hou Yuanxiang on the Internet because he cured many cancer patients. However, a Southern Weekend reporter's investigation found that it is questionable whether any cancer patients were actually cured by Hou Yuanxiang.

;

;After the first-instance verdict of the Hou Yuanxiang case, a list of cancer patients who claimed to be "cured by Hou Yuanxiang" leaked online. There were a total of 31 personal information of patients or patients' family members on the list. This list is consistent with that provided to Southern Weekend reporters by Gong Feiyun, one of Hou Yuanxiang’s supporters. According to Gong Feiyun, at the end of June 2023, he went to Qingdao to meet Hou Yuanxiang, and it was Hou Yuanxiang himself who gave him this list. Gong Feiyun is a partner of a local traditional Chinese medicine clinic. A few years ago, he was involved in a controversy when self-made medicines were deemed to be counterfeit.

;

;Southern Weekend reporters made all 31 calls on the list, of which 11 were not answered and 13 were refused. Of the 7 calls answered, 6 admitted that they were patients on the list or Family members, and another person denied that he was Che Moumou, the "Director of the Provincial Environmental Protection Bureau" written on the list, saying that he was "running business."

;

;Among the 6 people, 3 people refused to be interviewed on the grounds of "something happened" and "privacy involved", and only 3 people accepted the telephone interview.

;

;The patient, Song Yuanjia, is from Qingdao, Shandong. He claimed that he was "sentenced to death by the hospital." He approached Hou Yuanxiang with the mentality of giving it a try, and "it was fine once he tried it." "It has been 7 years now. Nothing".

;

;Song Yuan’s family told Southern Weekend reporters that Hou Yuanxiang’s medicine was an “ancestral medicine” and he spent more than 200,000 yuan without giving a prescription, first taking “Anti-Cancer No. 1” and “in the end he became poor. Feel better, take 'Anti-Cancer No. 2'".

;

;According to the first-instance verdict, when Hou Yuanxiang moved his homemade medicine and production tools overnight, he asked the Song Yuan family for help, and the Song Yuan family found a warehouse for him to store the items Hou Yuanxiang moved.

;

;Song Yuanjia told Southern Weekend reporters that he had read Hou Yuanxiang’s first-instance verdict, but he was more willing to believe the “crying out injustice” video on the self-media.

;

;Another interviewee, Wang Jingjiang, is a villager in a village in Zibo, Shandong, and the patient is his mother-in-law. He said that Hou Yuanxiang once planned to build a sanatorium in the village. He was driving for the village party secretary and got to know Hou. Later, his mother-in-law got cancer and there was no possibility of surgery. After undergoing chemotherapy for a period of time, he contacted "Professor Hou".

;

;Wang Jingjiang said that Hou Yuanxiang's medicine was "good" and his mother-in-law felt "strong" after drinking it. However, she stopped drinking it because she couldn't stand the taste.

;

;In the opinion of lawyer Yang Fengzhu, one of the experts in drafting and demonstrating traditional Chinese medicine laws, Hou Yuanxiang’s “anti-cancer drugs” are several Chinese medicines mixed together. Although Chinese medicine treatments rarely have “immediate results”, they are not It has no effect. "Once you take the (Chinese medicine) that replenishes qi, it will definitely have an effect."

;

;Wang Jingjiang also emphasized that his mother-in-law was not "cured", but "has not (re) committed the crime or been transferred."

;

;The third interviewee, Li Cheng (pseudonym), is from Yanbian, Jilin. He told Southern Weekend reporters that the patient was his grandfather, and he had indeed seen Hou Yuanxiang for medical treatment and taken his homemade medicine. The old man passed away in September 2022.

;

;Li Cheng said that his grandfather was diagnosed with rectal cancer in July 2019 and had spread to the lymph nodes. Relatives introduced him to Hou Yuanxiang. He has never met Hou Yuanxiang so far, and the two mainly communicate through WeChat. He said that after adding WeChat, Hou Yuanxiang once sent his personal profile, "I also searched on Baidu about world cancer, committees, and cancer treatment experts, and I could indeed find this person. I thought this person was quite good." sharp".

;

;When receiving a call from a Southern Weekend reporter, Li Cheng still called Hou Yuanxiang "Professor Hou." When he learned that Hou Yuanxiang was not a professor and did not even have a medical license, he was surprised and said that if he had known about this situation, he would "definitely consider" whether to seek medical treatment from Hou Yuanxiang.

;

;Li Cheng said that in addition to drinking Hou Yuanxiang’s anti-cancer drugs, his grandfather also ate the “nutritious meals” recommended by Hou Yuanxiang. "After about three courses of treatment, (grandpa) recovered very well." Li Cheng said, for this reason, he also introduced many patients to Hou Yuanxiang.

;

;However, Li Cheng could not confirm whether his grandfather's condition improved for a time. "Whether Professor Hou's medicine played a greater role or my grandfather's personal mentality played a greater role." Li Cheng said, "We all say that (Hou Yuanxiang's medicine) is effective and easy to use, and it may have played a supporting role in grandpa's mental state."

;

;Yang Fengzhu has participated in many clinical trial demonstrations of drugs. . In his opinion, when patients undergo treatment, "psychological effects are very important and can affect 30% of the (treatment) effect."

;

;Li Cheng also said that while his grandfather was taking Hou Yuanxiang's medicine, he also underwent other treatments, including surgery, and "Chinese and Western medicine worked simultaneously."

;

;After "slimming down" with fake medicine

;

;Neither the attorney nor Hou Yuanxiang himself expected that the first instance would impose such a severe sentence.

;

;However, according to relevant legal provisions and the amount of money involved ascertained by the driver’s agency, once Hou Yuanxiang’s self-made medicine is deemed to be counterfeit, the sentence will not be lenient.

;

;During the first trial, many attorneys representing the Hou family argued that Hou Yuanxiang’s self-made medicine did not cause any harm to the patient. Hou Yuanxiang himself also stated that "children can drink" his medicine.

;

;However, the lack of any harm does not mean that Hou Yuanxiang does not commit the crime of "producing and selling counterfeit drugs", nor does it mean that he cannot be severely sentenced.

;

;According to the criminal law before the 2011 revision, the crime of "producing and selling counterfeit drugs" requires "serious harm to human health" and causing death or serious injury in order to be sentenced to more than ten years in prison.

;

;Zhao Yin said that in order to increase the crackdown on counterfeit drugs, the Eighth Amendment to the Criminal Law in 2011 amended the "crime of producing and selling counterfeit drugs" and no longer included "seriously endangering human health". "As a threshold for criminalization, as long as the production and sale of counterfeit medicines constitutes a crime.

;

;At the same time, the Eighth Amendment to the Criminal Law no longer requires death or serious injury as the only condition for a heavy sentence. It stipulates that "other particularly serious circumstances" can also be harshly sentenced. In 2014, the Supreme People's Court and the Supreme People's Procuratorate issued a judicial interpretation that as long as the production and sale of counterfeit drugs reaches 500,000 yuan, it constitutes "other particularly serious circumstances" under the Eighth Amendment to the Criminal Law.

;

;The first-instance court determined that Hou Yuanxiang’s production and sales of counterfeit drugs amounted to more than 14.36 million yuan, far exceeding 500,000 yuan. This means that once Hou Yuanxiang’s homemade medicine is determined to be counterfeit, he will be sentenced to more than ten years in prison.

;

;Whether Hou Yuanxiang’s self-made medicine can be recognized as counterfeit medicine must be based on the Drug Administration Law. Zhao Yin believes that before the law was revised in 2019, the identification of counterfeit drugs was relatively simple - as long as the drug did not obtain a batch number, it would be "treated as a counterfeit drug", thus constituting a counterfeit drug in the sense of criminal law.

;

;However, the Drug Administration Law revised in 2019 has made major changes to the definition of counterfeit drugs. Drugs without batch numbers are no longer automatically treated as counterfeit drugs.

;

;The industry generally believes that the above-mentioned modifications to the Drug Administration Law are related to the Hunan Lu Yong case. Lu Yong, a leukemia patient, purchased generic drugs from informal channels and helped his patients purchase the drugs. In 2018, the movie "I'm Not the God of Medicine" based on it was released, triggering widespread public discussion on China's drug management system.

;

;The revised Drug Administration Law stipulates that counterfeit drugs can be classified as counterfeit drugs only under four circumstances (see the information link at the end of the article for details).

;

;According to Cao Guoying, director of the Beijing Changjiang Pharmaceutical Development Foundation, who has long been engaged in anti-counterfeiting practice and research on drugs, after the revision of the Drug Administration Law, the number of counterfeit drug cases handled by the drug regulatory department showed a "cliff-like decline."

;

;According to data from the website of the State Food and Drug Administration, in 2019, the number of counterfeit drug cases investigated and dealt with by drug regulatory departments across the country was 14,041. In the following year after the revision of the Drug Administration Law, the number of such cases There were only 7,361 cases, a decrease of nearly half.

;

;A reporter from Southern Weekend searched the Judgment Documents Network using the keyword "counterfeit drugs" and found that based on the revision of the Drug Administration Law, the number of judgments in criminal cases of counterfeit drugs dropped sharply from 5,044 in 2019 to 2020. Of the 2,361 pieces, more than half were missing. There was also a downward trend in the following years.

;

;The 2019 version of the Drug Administration Law has significantly increased fines while "slimming down" counterfeit drugs. "The starting point of the fine is 15 times the production and sales amount, and if it is less than 100,000, it will be calculated as 100,000." Zhao Yin said, "As long as you are producing and selling counterfeit drugs, you will be fined at least 1.5 million, and you will be punished to death (for production, sales, etc.) Selling counterfeit medicines)."

;

;Are Chinese medicinal materials medicines?

;

;In Cao Guoying's view, under the current overall environment of drug counterfeiting, it is "very difficult" for Qingdao to investigate the Hou Yuanxiang case.

;

;However, whether Hou Yuanxiang should be held criminally responsible for "producing and selling counterfeit drugs" has caused controversy in both the legal and traditional Chinese medicine circles.

;

;The Hou family’s attorney cited the revised Drug Administration Law in 2019 as an excuse to believe that Hou Yuanxiang’s self-made medicine is made from traditional Chinese medicinal materials and should not be regarded as counterfeit medicine. Hou Yuanxiang and others do not constitute “production.” , the crime of selling counterfeit medicines."

;

;In fact, according to the first-instance judgment of Hou Yuanxiang’s case, the public security organs initially opened a case against Hou Yuanxiang and others for “illegal business operations.”

;

;One month after the case was filed, the Qingdao Municipal Supervision Bureau issued a counterfeit drug identification certificate, identifying Hou Yuanxiang’s four self-made medicines as counterfeit drugs. According to the relevant judicial interpretations issued by the highest law and the highest detection in 2014, it is difficult to determine the "fake drugs" and "inferior drugs", and the judicial organs can determine the determination opinions issued by the drug supervision and management departments above the city level.

;

; According to the above identification, Hou Yuanxiang's self -made "Anti -Cancer No. 1", "Anti -Cancer 2", "liver" claiming to treat liver cancer, and "wild heart brain soup" used to treat heart disease The medicine is identified as a fake medicine.

;

; After the case entered the review and prosecution stage, at the request of the People's Procuratorate of Huangdao District, the Qingdao Municipal Supervision Bureau specially issued a supplementary explanation to explain why the products involved were identified as fake medicines.

;

; Instructions point out that Hou Yuanxiang's four self -made products "no drug registration certificate, no medical institution preparation filing, no drug production license, no medical institution preparation permit, no national standard, etc. Pharmaceuticals that promote the treatment of cancer, liver cancer, cardiovascular and cerebrovascular diseases, etc. are sold to patients to cure diseases. P>;

; A second -instance agent lawyer pointed out that on the one hand, the above discussion said that the product involved in the case was "in line with the definition of drugs", and on the other hand, it was "non -drug". In its opinion, the reason why Qingdao Municipal Supervision Bureau discusses this is because according to the New Drug Management Law, "the only thing that can be stuck is this one (non -pharmaceutical impersonation)."

;

; Regarding Hou Yuanxiang's self -made medicine identification issues, the reporter from the southern weekend contacted the Qingdao Municipal Supervision Bureau. The bureau refused to interview on the grounds of the Hou Yuanxiang case.

;

; During the first instance, almost all the acting lawyers of the Hou family questioned the false drug determination of the case. One of the lawyers pointed out that most of the medicinal materials used in "Anti -Cancer 1" and "Anti -Cancer 2" were in the 2020 version of "Chinese Pharmacopoeia", which did not conform to "impersonation of medicines with non -drug".

;

; However, in Zhao Yin's view, Chinese medicinal materials are not of course considered medicines -Chinese medicinal materials are only raw materials for making drugs and can be sold in the medicinal material market. Sale.

;

; Where is the medicinal materials used by Hou Yuanxiang's father and daughter's self -made medicine? There is no explanation in the relevant confession quoted in the first instance judgment, and Hou Jing cannot provide the purchase of the purchase and legal certification documents. ; Li Gang, the acting lawyer of the second instance, questioned the fake drugs involved in the case involved in the case of the case, and questioned the fake drug identification letter based on the judgment of the first trial.

;

; According to the newly introduced judicial interpretation of the highest law and the highest prosecution in 2022 (the old judicial interpretation of the old judicial interpretation in 2014), the situation of "non -drug pretending to medicine" can only be in the case where there is no controversy. Below, the municipal pharmaceutical regulatory department can be directly identified as fake medicine. For controversy, it is necessary to check or determine the pharmaceutical inspection agency set by the drug supervision and management department of the provincial level.

;

; In Li Gang's view, the identification of the fake drugs involved in the case of Hou Yuanxiang obviously controversial and should be tested. However, he believes that folk traditional Chinese medicine recipes lack national standards, and even if the results are tested, it lacks scientific and legitimacy. And Hou Yuanxiang's medicine was not tested at the time, and now it has been seized for more than a year. "It has been deteriorated early, how to test it?"

;

; On November 5, 2023, another agent lawyer of Hou Yuanxiang told the Southern Weekend reporter that After the case was returned to the retrial, the procuratorial organs supplemented a lot of evidence to the court, including a inspection report on Hou Yuanxiang's self -pharmaceutical. According to this inspection report, Hou Yuanxiang's self -made drug detected the western medicine composition to treat diabetes. The Qingdao Municipal Supervision Bureau still determined that the product involved was a fake medicine.

;

; Hou Yuanxiang's above -mentioned acting lawyer said that this shows that the pharmaceutical regulatory department may no longer determine the product involved in the case in accordance with the "non -pharmaceutical impersonation medicine".

;

; For Hou Yuanxiang's charges, Yang Zhiwei, a lawyer of Guangdong Fa Quan Law Firm, put forward another point of view to reporters from the south weekend: if Hou Yuanxiang's "Anti -Cancer No. 1" and "Anti -Cancer 2" are clear and treating cancer "Do not match the world", Hou Yuanxiang is entirely the purpose of selling medicines, so he may constitute a crime of fraud.

;

; A reporter from the Southern Weekend found such a case on the referee document network: In 2019, Li Mouxiang, who did not qualify for medicine, was arrested for production and sales of fake drugs, but the Procuratorate arrested and arrested him with fraud. ;

; Is Hou Yuanxiang suspected of fraud? A reporter from the Southern Weekend asked about a first -instance lawyer of Hou Yuanxiang. After a few seconds of silence, the lawyer asked: Scam? Isn't that heavier? Later, he said that Hou Yuanxiang was "unlikely" to constitute a crime of fraud.

; "Women with a public security background"

; After the video was released, "Chinese Medicine Chen Lei" was siege by many supporters of Hou Yuanxiang. Wu Pengfei released 8 short videos to refute. It didn't take long for the video of "Chinese medicine Chen Lei" to get off.

; After seeing Hou Yuanxiang's fake medicine on the Internet, Qian Hui, general manager of Nanjing Guishi Hall Traditional Chinese Medicine Museum, decided to support it. ;

; At the end of 2017, Guishi Hall was reported. Because the batch number was not obtained, its homemade medicine was identified as a fake medicine by the Nanjing Pharmaceutical Bureau. The crime of medicine was once detained by the police, and Qian Hui was locked for 28 days.

;

; "Why do we support Hou Yuanxiang's innocence? The main reason is from the perspective of protecting traditional Chinese medicine, because once Hou Yuanxiang's case is guilty, many traditional Chinese medicine can not do it anymore." To the southern weekend reporter.

; Gong Feiyun, one of Guishitang's "partner", traditional Chinese medicine is "folk Chinese medicine", and Hou Yuanxiang is one of many "folk Chinese medicine". ;

; At the end of June 2013, Gong Feiyun went to Qingdao to meet Hou Yuanxiang. According to Gong Feiyun, although Hou Yuanxiang had been "monitored and lived" by the police at that time, he was not strict at that time. He tried to make an appointment and made a video.

;

; Before Qian Hui and Gong Feiyun, another "folk Chinese medicine" supporter Guan Le also supported Hou Yuanxiang online.

; Guanle claims to be "the first principal of the University of Folk Traditional Chinese Medicine", "Great Wall inscription character" and "Chairman of the World Chinese Medicine Hall". Guan Le once publicly said that after the university was established, he will select "Academician of Folk Traditional Chinese Medicine", "Doctor of Traditional Chinese Medicine" and "Professor of Folk Traditional Chinese Medicine".

;

; Related information shows that in June 2020, the slogan of the establishment of "Folk Traditional Chinese Medicine" just shouted, and Guan Le claimed to hold a establishment meeting of a branch of the university. ;

; After going to Qingdao to meet Hou Yuanxiang, Gong Feiyun and Guan Le met in Shanghai. And ask him to speak up in the case of Hou Yuanxiang.

;

; On September 9, 2023, the preparatory meeting of the Second Civil Medicine University planned by Guanle was held in Beijing. During the meeting, the Hou Yuanxiang case was discussed during the meeting.

;

; "(Hou Yuanxiang case) is equivalent to uniting all folk Chinese medicine." Gong Feiyun told the southern weekend reporter.

".

; "I no longer participate in this matter"

;

; Li Cheng (pseudonym) is the grandson of a patient with a Jilin cancer patient in Hou Yuanxiang. In the case, he also participated in the public opinion battle for Hou Yuanxiang.

;

; On June 8, 2022, after Hou Yuanxiang filed a appeal, a WeChat person named "Meteor and sunset" added Li Cheng's WeChat, claiming to be the daughter -in -law of "Professor Hou".

;

; "Can you write a joint letter to Professor Hou for a love?"

;

; "What happened to Professor Hou?"

;

; "I was reported by others , Now I still can't take my own medicine in the hospital. "

;

; Li Cheng knew that Hou Yuanxiang had an accident. He told" Meteor and sunset "that he could help Hou Yuanxiang write a joint letter.

;

; Two months later, "Meteor and sunset" pulled Li Cheng into a WeChat group that supported Hou Yuanxiang.

; Li Cheng's mobile phone has a number marked as "Director Li's anti -cancer", which was given by Hou Yuanxiang. He bought medicine for Grandpa to contact this "Director Li".

; But in fact, "Director Li" is Hou Yuanxiang's son Hou Lei, "Meteor and sunset" is Li Jianying. She is also the only one among all the Hou family.

; Later, Hou Yuanxiang sent some case materials to Li Cheng to help him contact the media. There have been no news since then. Li Cheng failed to help Hou Yuanxiang contact the media.
